document.title: VIRGINIA WORLD LANGUAGE STANDARDS OF LEARNING 2021 Novice—Advanced

2439ECAB94B44342B62E8F879461D840.description:
NH: • Give a short description about a favorite character
from a story, book, movie, or television show.

A417B267D65A464BA14301AAF9D5C657.description:
NH: • Make after school.plans with others.
• Interact with others in everyday situations, such as at
lunch, recess, or visiting a friend’s house.

41D38507FCBF4DD68EE3AF681FD51E19.description:
NM: • Answer a variety of simple questions.
• Introduce self and others.
• Communicate basic information about self and
personal acquaintances.
• Tell simple information related to content taught in
other classes using a graphic organizer.
• Name family members or friends, what their
relationship is, and what they like to do.

91161A517B2E45A98599198BB8086627.description:
NL: • Name or label familiar things in the classroom, at
school, or in images

50FB7EC83B7948FEAAD60B8885E400F3.description:
IL:  Identify the sequences in a story or cartoon.
• Identify the topic of a story or conversation.
• Recognize that ideas and expressions may be
presented differently in the target language than the
students’ language.

5D539D8E913A4DBF86F269AA54F8651C.description:
NH: • Understand words, phrases or information related to
content taught in other classes.
• Understand simple messages on greeting cards.
• Identify a few product details from an ad or
commercial.
• Identify a few events in a cartoon, TV show, or
movie clip.
• Identify information in a simple diagram or
infographic.

19220B3F267A49B7A333A95C61448CCE.description:
NM:  Identify simple phrases describing physical or
personality traits of a story, cartoon, or movie
character.
• Identify simple information from words and symbols
in a weather forecast, science experiment, or math
problem.

1ECEECEB26DA4EDDA372CE2B499944E7.description:
NL: • Recognize or draw a few individual words from
posters or labeled objects inside the classroom.
• Match a letter, character, word, or color to an image.
• Recognize or draw traditional and nontraditional
letters, numbers, or shapes that are similar to content
from other classes.
• Recognize a character’s name in a story or fairy tale.

4C9980A9EE8F4131B516CAF3A126226F.description:
IL: • Use culturally appropriate formal and informal
register when conversing with peers or adults at
school or school events.

6D04D8E1C6E044F098A1887A79C5C2F2.description:
NH: • Use culturally appropriate titles and signature in a
simple letter or email.

D18533EB8ABF44EF9325FFBA57266CFC.description:
NM: • Use practiced culturally appropriate behaviors and
practices such as emotional expressions or telling the
time and date.
• Recognize words, phrases, or simple facts related to
content taught in other classes.

918DA0D871CC4823951E49DD677EC317.description:
NL: • Rehearse appropriate behaviors and practices from
native and other cultures, such as greetings or
showing respect.
• EL1.3 Imitate greetings and emotional expressions
from the target culture

166789B4314C4A9182919388C181E4CC.description: Investigate Intercultural Products and Practices to Help Understand Perspectives

2C2BDE0AF5DB471F89122951E89600AF.description:
IH: • Give step-by-step
directions on
preparing a recipe
from the target
culture.

69F5BB0FA1174A7C980545A961320A09.description:
IL: • Compare simple
patterns of behavior
or interaction in
various cultural
settings, such as
transportation to
school, or eating
habits.
• Compare and contrast
myths, folktales and
poetry of the native
and target cultures.

9E842E24BDC04B41B64FD400564A6559.description:
NH: • Give a short
description about a
favorite character
from a story, book,
movie, or television
show
• Participate in ageappropriate cultural
practices such as
being the leader or
taking turns in
games, sports and
entertainment such as
music, dance or
drama.

0A6DE1AEB616443DB0F2321736B05772.description:
NM: • Label familiar items
in the classroom, at
school, related to
content images and
compare them to
items in the target
cultures.
• Identify products and
practices from the
target culture in
photos and short
videos.

6B12C1418626412DBC14A066D99F5657.description:
NL: • Identify familiar
items in the
classroom, at school,
or content images and
compare them to the
target cultures.
• Participate in ageappropriate cultural
activities such as
storytelling, reader’s
theatre, games and
songs.

99BD4C2D25524ADC9381C20DF3526CEA.description: Presentational Speaking, Signing or Writing and Integrated Intercultural Competence

59C47C22D17A4AD99957E49E7C841269.description:
AL: • Compare and
contrast life in
different locations
and in different
times.

DA0F0C5471704F80AD958BBDB8C7AD4C.description:
IH: • Complete a task that
requires multiple
steps, such as
refurbishing a piece
of furniture.

223240E68EEB434E8AEB157CF6BA8630.description:
IL: • Ask simple questions
about characteristics
of daily life after
looking at photos or
short videos.
• Use gestures
appropriately to greet
friends, family, or
new acquaintances.

6F9D0F6C64774166831EE261C6A1AD45.description:
NH: • Identify what people
from the target
culture are doing in
photos and short
videos.

3A613AA56CA548FC9B5B88A40DBE7369.description:
NM: • Use learned culturally
appropriate gestures,
behaviors, and oral
expressions for
greetings, leave
takings, and common
classroom or social
interactions within
native and target
cultures.
• Participate in ageappropriate cultural
activities such as
storytelling,
dramatizations, or
games. • Use high frequency
courtesy phrases
when interacting with
peers, such as please,
thank you, or your
turn.

7CE4FCE7316E43D4ACBD0425A059BCDB.description:
NL: • Identify or repeat
names of tangible
products of the native
and target cultures
such as currency,
communities, dress,
toys, famous people,
and art.
• Participate in ageappropriate cultural
activities such as
storytelling,
dramatizations, or
games.

625C3C74FD9446A7A32456163CE5099B.description: Interpersonal Communication and Integrated Intercultural Competence

C795815B60114CC1AA382395D0244D75.description:
AH: • Evaluate global
products and
practices and mediate
perspectives in text
and media topics.

A7A1D9E3A2F44DC0A957C18F1BE5577A.description:
AM: • Analyze different or
similar points of
view on topics of
personal and global
importance such as
environment,
education, and
media.

8CA237D2026F4FE4B46D5F4E25F5A44E.description:

story and some
supporting detail
across major time
frames in fictional
texts.

3EF55543CB234EB2B7B25B310F90D628.description:
IH: • Read or listen to
stories from other
cultures and compare
them to familiar
stories from the same
genre, such as
folklore, fables,
myths, and legends.

BF27073559704E9B95DE5C3B4D5B9D39.description:
IM: • Follow a series of
directions, such as a
destination in the
classroom or
building, or solving a
simple math
problem.

A75EF5DE0523432C914131D10FB3F3DA.description:
IL: • Understand products,
practices and
perspectives of
native and other
cultures from texts
about familiar topics
with some details,
such as famous
monuments or tv
programming.
• Follow multi step
instructions to
complete a craft or
play a game.
• Listen to or read
about expressive
products of the target
culture such as
children’s or
traditional songs,
selections from the
literature commonly
read, and types of
artwork enjoyed or
produced by peers in
other cultures.

EA62FD269C7B4222B6715A74895DEB46.description:
NH: • Follow simple steps
to create an object,
play a game, solve a
puzzle or follow a
scavenger hunt

69381E4BBDDA4A2491653BCB6757470A.description:
NM: • Use culturally
appropriate behaviors
to follow familiar
classroom
instructions and
routines.

7A0CE66110EB4E49B3A3EA12F252942A.description:
NL: • Identify and imitate
culturally appropriate
gestures and
behaviors for
common classroom
or social interactions
and routines within
native and other
cultures.

C053C904676243DFA3DEC4D7BAE4F237.description: Interpretive Listening, Viewing or Reading and Integrated Intercultural Competence

C3628DD4908647439A4DEA77F6BB393E.description: NH: • State simple facts or details about a landmark or place visited.

216E38037C0D4DD292241CC6138A88E1.description:
NM: • Sign simple information based on photos of animals, historical figures,
or sports.

340FE4450C804E55A1597B05544438D8.description: NL: • Sign simple directions or a line from a simple poem.

F974566DB3E54BD59F88642C0F0F2199.description: NH: • Make plans with a peer about where to go and when to meet.

DE698AABA7F94D609249838A71BF9189.description: NM: • Ask who, what, when, where, and why questions

2E83949D140446DEA373709BD167D455.description: NL: • Respond to yes, no, who, what, when, and where questions.

FBA3AE56073C4D0A9AD2E2A76B6767C4.description: NH: • Understand a simple transaction between a customer and clerk.

47527855391445B38B14625188A20CEB.description: NM: • Recognize a few variations on simple signs or phrases.

1793DF5281DB482B93E57536E2426BCC.description: NL: • Follow a few simple classroom directions.

6BFD74FC13B04CAB85375D569462E1C6.description:
AL: • Create a shareable
presentation on modern and
ancient value systems.

1EB31DE8AA224A04A1C9E3115674A5BE.description:
IM: • Create and share a graphic
organizer comparing and
contrasting modern and
ancient ideas about the ideal
lifestyle.

6315A2995FCA4491A8148240FCC7E978.description:

member of the Roman
military.
• Present a living history
moment as a figure from
Roman culture.

3748F613F9E54F0BBCF8D10F48829F93.description:

very familiar themes.

AA9E968F3595428DA7870627C27CC6C1.description:
NM: • Follow familiar written
instructions for routines
such as posted directions in
the classroom.

B5B72DA34E26414BA0FE6D734EF4422F.description:
NL: • Follow familiar written
instructions for routines,
such as posted directions in
the classroom.

3B1B766BE3CE4079AF39E08DD7C83E97.description:
AL: • Compare cultural
perspectives that influence
the opinions of historical
figures.
• Understand more complex
structures and syntax to
deepen comprehension.
• Consistently understand
more complex aural
features of the text and its
meaning or interpretation.

5CA4C6CC57B648BBA0E9F92AEB75E0B8.description:
IH: • Identify simple
characteristics of various
literary and non-literary
genres.
• Understand more complex
structures and syntax to
deepen comprehension.
• Understand aural features
of the text, such as meter,
alliteration, assonance, and
its impact on the meaning
or interpretation.

533BBE63B5FA4436895B2C65D3CBE6F3.description:
IM: • Compare more complex
literary and non-literary
texts using the author's
point of view, conflicts or
tone.
• Understand more complex
structures and syntax to
deepen comprehension.
• Demonstrate understanding
of the connection between
ancient and modern events.

F2920E5456BD40ADA62FD288EA8C4E56.description:
IL: • Identify supporting details
in simple texts.
• Use language structures and
syntax to deepen
understanding.
• Compare events in two or
more simple texts, such as
theme, sequencing, or
importance to story line.

457FF71A38D2405FA55756CAAA4BCE71.description:
NH: • Identify the topic or basic
facts or details from simple
texts.
• Recognize language
patterns, simple structures,
and syntax to facilitate
understanding.
• Understand connected
sentences describing events
surrounding historical
characters.

AA456B98BBA440A19E18B257FBC0E01A.description:
NM: • Recognize Roman numerals
or Greek letters.
• Recognize language
patterns or simple structures
to facilitate understanding.
• Understand simple phrases
describing historical
characters.

63EC84009A1F46179F5FC9993E21D799.description:
NL: • Connect simple words,
phrases, Roman numerals,
or Greek letters to their
meaning or image.
• Recognize simple structures
to facilitate understanding.
• Recognize names of historic
characters.

F36CAADD736C4BC893B5A24FE4B1DD14.description:
IL: • Describe a dream trip,
including where, how, and
when this will take place.

B8440CB9491C42129D2049A5B9B8C170.description:
NM: • Share opinions about
preferences of certain
foods.

BEB733660061460F87BCB75527AC7913.description: Support a Preference, Opinion, Viewpoint or Argument

DEDB817E30D8414182A70390589AD579.description:
NH: • Complete a medical form to
explain an ailment.

0630419EB49F4EB3ABC1812E69AAC28A.description: Narrate About Life, Events or Experiences

7CB89924836A4DAE930C02252C3F027A.description:
AL: • Create a list of suggestions
and recommendations for
avoiding food, water, and
energy waste

641A015CBC1F485A847803950379CD5F.description:

Week blog post for the

the steps and movements

7AC0BC4F9CC5454BB90EECF02EEE00F6.description:

or a demonstration

A6CEE148B2AF4F9C9FCB598A80EF9A44.description:
IL: • Give a friend directions for
using various public
transportation options to
meet at a desired
destination.
• Create instructions for a
basic children’s game.

AEEAF84148A6486587DF7211DE9FFB1E.description:
NH: • Fill in a planner with steps
to meet a deadline for a
school, work or
extracurricular project.
• Create a to-do list to plan a
party

9CBEAEA3A60746AA9FCD07D016439724.description:
NM: • Provide information in a
passport application before
a trip overseas.
• Provide a list of chores and
responsibilities for your
family.

CBDA37AABF2F47069297199227F7E5B8.description:
NL: • Write a short personal bio
for a webpage.

6296F7A8B651452B8D90C386B570C188.description: Inform, Describe, Explain, or Provide Instructions

89BD30F7A48A48FCBA7350EAF4722654.description:
NH: • Use culturally appropriate
information in a recipe.

53D59C4A045248E983E422A79B2D5AD7.description:
AL: • Describe impacts of a
scientific invention.
• Explain the steps and results

• Produce a podcast giving
the steps to solve a math
equation.

74310EDFC9144617B750D48F0F8E74E9.description:
IH: • Explain animal
endangerment.
• Produce a podcast giving
some suggestions for living
an eco-friendly lifestyle.

A292263D94364C26AB609671FA17C8D7.description:
IM: • Present findings about
challenges of modern
families.
• Present on a literary figure
or author and his or her
contributions to society.
• Provide multi-step
instructions at a health fair
to maintain a healthy
lifestyle or exercise
program.
• Give advice on how to
prepare a healthy meal.

F2F4A6D1576C441FBDF298B957ADCA8F.description:
IL: • Describe the events of a
story line.
• Describe pros and cons of
various forms of media and
modes of communication.
• Provide multi-step
instructions for various
modes of transport.

4BE4D74A04124DA69BEC3E120154B320.description:
NH: • Introduce a school or
program for visiting
exchange students.
• Give a friend driving
directions from school to a
destination.
• Provide instructions for a
recipe.

E166AA502F52457DAA5CA48B6BE43495.description:
NM: • Describe clothing for
different occasions.
• Explain preferences for
sports, pastimes, foods, or
clothing choices.
• Use familiar commands and
courtesy phrases during a
game with peers.
• Ask peers to do simple tasks
in class.

E8AC4326BCC44FA29F4A03A8AC59262A.description:
NL: • Give a phone number,
email, or the combination to
unlock a locker.
• Order food in restaurant

9B5A548B8EF14CC3A7E3FA9412FA9C1A.description: Inform, Describe, Explain, or Provide Instructions

527515959AC848FF923319335E50F6AF.description:
AL: • Exchange advice online
about how to behave when
visiting a family for dinner
in a different culture.
• Collaborate online with
fellow classmates to
provide advice for next
year’s students on how to
be successful in language
class.
• Add an opinion about a
social issue on an online
blog.
• Continue an email
exchange to convince a
colleague to switch sides in
an argument.
• Create multiple blog entries
offering advice on how to
make the most of time in
the another country,
responding to several
rounds of response.

6A9E605F86D74960AAF6515E2A8003C7.description:
IH: • Justify opinions about
current trends in music in
an online conversation.
• Give advice online to a
foreign student who has
questions about studying in
the USA.
• Exchange opinions about a
product on a company’s
website and say why or
why not to buy it.
• Exchange posts that
provide specific and
detailed advice on a peer’s
draft for an article.
• Add advice about dating
“do’s and don’ts” on an
online blog.

0F16CF1DD9244040ABBD33DC073AE962.description:
IM: • Participate in an online
discussion in which people
react to opportunities for
part-time jobs.
• Participate in an online
discussion about what kind
of diet is best.
• Exchange opinions on a
discussion board about
which nominee deserves an
award and why.
• Post a positive book review
in response to a negative
one.
• Participate in a fitness
forum about staying fit
without joining a gym.

7E2AF0557C93469A8BFB0FB794BD3AB6.description:
IL: • Exchange text messages
sharing reactions to
something happening in the
community.
• Compare the importance of
and opportunities for
extracurricular activities in
various cultures.
• Exchange descriptions with
an ePal to agree on the best
places to hike in the US.
• Exchange online messages
to trade opinions in reaction
to an article about the best
places to visit in the region.
• Chat with an ePal to
discuss Americans’ typical
vacations.
• Exchange advice with
another online player on
winning moves in a video
game.

FADD445CCBCC47FEBA8557E158950D48.description:
NH:  Ask and react to a friend’s
post on a social media site.
• Exchange preferences of
things to do with visitors on
a shared Wiki.
• Add comments to those of
others about something
read on a forum about
sports.
• Exchange preferences in
video games on a gaming
site.

EC89CB7042164757BA7A8BB19E0C2FD9.description:
NM: • React to a text from a
friend about a new movie
and ask for an opinion
about the film.
• Choose answers on an
online personality survey.
• Read a note from a
roommate about evening
plans and write a short
response.
• Tweet an opinion about a
new movie in response to
other tweets.
• React to classmates’ posts
on an online learning tool.

A6E0F1384BEC40F78A901350C42216FA.description:
NL: • Respond to a simple
interactive survey about
favorite pets, movies or
clothes.
• Respond to a social media
site about best restaurants
or best sports teams,
indicating approval or
disapproval.
• Text a friend about
preference to meet and
when.
• Text dinner preferences.
• Complete a simple survey
to identify likes and
dislikes about a store or
service.

53186B004AE04613999F6B71B3E5179E.description: Express, React to and Support Preferences, Opinions or Viewpoints

8C2F45E55D294CAEB03B0C44CCF70617.description:
AL: • Exchange messages with a
friend to explain one’s
reasons for canceling a
planned activity.
• Exchange posts in response
to an article about a
political issue.
• Negotiate with an online
agent the release of
information needed for a
college application.
• Exchange correspondence
with an event planner to
make changes to an
upcoming celebration.

0F7348345E2F4493A705041C25F9E46D.description:

• Respond to a series of
inquiries from a potential
employer as part of a job
application.

29014246454649E7A0F0BA83446FDF9D.description:

another culture to finalize
plans for hosting them in

• Exchange messages with

travel agent to switch flight

FB1405C311464E968907EE97A6005191.description:

complete an assignment for

type of housing that best
fits one’s needs.

155B63DD7D0C498DBB7069AFDC861CE0.description:
NH: • Exchange information with

messages.
• Exchange information with
a doctor’s office to prepare
for an upcoming
appointment.

127A7E461C394C9B8ADFED1B2C5197FF.description:

with a peer or family
member via text via text
messages.
• Ask questions to the online
sales rep about an item.

FBCC32817A894850ADEF4190B6437BFF.description:
NL: • Enter a word in an online
Scrabble game.
• Add happy birthday to a

• Reply to a message asking

counselor to discuss indemand jobs where a

6C99084E495C41418B37C7DEF05C10F4.description:
IH: • Participate in a chat to
discuss the importance of
learning another language.
• Collaborate with an online

publicize an upcoming
event.
• Exchange blog posts about
environmental issues.
• Exchange ideas for a
collaborative project in an
online news group.

0CA21C187A824E50886FB8ED4DFA2E57.description:

different mapping apps

partner to identify ways to

IL: • Exchange texts with a

in an online chat.
• Send an electronic
invitation to teachers for an
upcoming school
performance and answer
questions they may have.

BDAA62EBEEC04B0688C793E262CAE41D.description:
NM: • Write a post-it note in

answering who, what,
where and or when
questions.

that asks where one is
going.

behavior typically
associated with the target
cultures.

cultural norms and family
dynamics.
